intro: Cayratia benthamiana, commonly known as the Chinese maypole vine, is a climbing plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender, twining stems and heart-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are clustered in umbels, followed by red, fleshy berries. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates and is often found in moist, shaded environments. Its botanical features make it a subject of interest in both horticulture and ecological studies.
